sentence.Network_en: The days begin to draw in after the summer solstice.
sentence.Network_cn: 夏至之后白天开始变短.

sentence.Network_en: The days begin to draw out after the winter solstice.
sentence.Network_cn: 冬至以后,白天渐渐变长.

sentence.Network_en: Tomorrow will be the Summer Solstice.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, from Latin solstitium, from sol 'sun' + stit- 'stopped, stationary' (from the verb sistere)

entry.def: The summer solstice is the day of the year with the most hours of daylight, and the winter solstice is the day of the year with the fewest hours of daylight.

means.word_mean: 1. either of the two times of the year when the sun is at its greatest distance from the celestial equator
